intro: Cypella pardalis, commonly known as the spotted cypella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately compound, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Cypella pardalis is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
